title: Trisha Krishnan on board for Vikram-Hari's Saamy 2 : Celebrities, News - India Today
text:
Celebrities Trisha Krishnan on board for Vikram-Hari's Saamy 2 Trisha, who played the eponymous character Bhuvana in Saamy, will reprise her role in the upcoming sequel Saamy 2. IndiaToday.in | Written by Srivatsan A + A - Vikram-Trisha from Saamy 
Basking in the glorious success of Singam 3, director Hari has started works on his next with Chiyaan Vikram for Saamy 2. 
Saamy, which released in 2003, went on to become one of the highest grossing Tamil films of that year. The film, which tells the story of an honest cop DCP Aarusaamy, opened to rave reviews from critics and audience. With a glaring state of commercial films these days, Saamy is one of the well-made commercial films in Tamil. It was also remade in Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Bengali. 
Now, the team is once again uniting for Saamy 2, which will mark Vikram's return as the foul-mouthed police officer Aarusamy. Much like its predecessor, Trisha will reprising her character in Saamy 2. Notably, Saamy was also praised for Trisha-Vikram's on screen romance, which paved the way for their second collaboration in Bheema.

Earlier to this, Hari went on the record saying that he's yet to finalise the heroine despite having Trisha, who already played the lead in Saamy. 
Meanwhile, Vikram and Trisha are shooting for their Dhruva Natchathiram and Garjani respectively. Saamy 2 is expected to release in the second half of 2017.
